Package org.neo4j.io.layout

Class Neo4jLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.io.layout.Neo4jLayout
  • public final class Neo4jLayout
extends Object
    File layout representation of neo4j instance that provides the ability to reference any store specific file that can be created by particular store implementation.
    Any file lookup should use provided layout or particular database layout.
    Neo4J layout represent layout of whole neo4j instance while particular database layout represent single database. Neo4J layout should be used as a factory of any layouts for particular database.
    Any user-provided home or store directory will be transformed to canonical file form and any subsequent layout file lookup should be considered as operations that provide canonical file form.
    Store lock file is global per store and should be looked from specific store layout.
    Example of Neo4j layout for store with 2 databases: 
      home directory
  | \ data directory
  | | \ store directory
  | | | \ database directory (neo4j, represented by separate database layout)
  | | | | \ particular database files
  | | | \ database directory (other represented by separate database layout)
  | | | | \ particular database files
  | | | \ store_lock
  | | \ transaction logs directory
  | | | \ database transactions directory (neo4j, represented by separate database layout)
  | | | | \ particular database transactions files
  | | | \ database transactions directory (other represented by separate database layout)
  | | | | \ particular database transactions files
  | | \ script directory
  | | | \ database script directory (neo4j, represented by separate database layout)
  | | | | \ particular database script files
  | | | \ database script directory (other represented by separate database layout)
  | | | | \ particular database script files
    The current implementation does not keep references to all requested and provided files and requested layouts but can be easily enhanced to do so.
    Most file & directory locations of the layout can be individually configured using their corresponding setting.
    See Also:
    DatabaseLayout

      • databaseLayouts

        public Collection<DatabaseLayout> databaseLayouts()
        Try to return database layouts for directories that located in the current store directory. Each sub directory of the store directory treated as a separate database directory and database layout wrapper build for that.
        Returns:
        database layouts for directories located in current store directory. If no subdirectories exist empty collection is returned.

      • databaseLayout

        public DatabaseLayout databaseLayout​(String databaseName)
        Provide layout for a database with provided name. No assumptions whatsoever should be taken in regards of database location. Newly created layout should be used to any kind of file related requests in scope of a database.
        Parameters:
        databaseName - database name to provide layout for
        Returns:
        requested database layout

      • databasesDirectory

        public Path databasesDirectory()
        Databases root directory where all databases are located.
        Returns:
        all databases root directory

        Neo4J root directory.
        Returns:
